Summary: Looked up from back yard and saw bright planetary sized circle that did not move and faded out rapidly in less than 1 minute.
trends: There have been 21 other sightings in Katy
There was one other sighting in Katy on or around October 25th 2013
divs: Sighting DetailsI had just gone out into the back yard to feed the dogs. It was crisp and totally clear sky with excellent visibility. I looked up and saw a planetary sized light to the northwest at about 80 degrees from the horizon. It caught my eye because it was bright and I had never seen a star or planet in that position at that time. I looked closely at it and it was white and starlike and perfectly circular. In something less than a minute of observation, it faded out - not twinkling out like a star and other stars that were less visible were still plainly visible in the brightening sky. It faded out quickly - just disappeared. I looked for it for another minute or so and it did not reappear. It was stationary and should have still been visible in some form. I have seen iridium flares and know it was not this. There was no change in light intensity.
